content.4: To whom hast thou uttered words? and whose spirit came from thee?
content.7: He stretcheth out the north over the empty place,
content.8: He bindeth up the waters in his thick clouds; and the cloud is not rent under them.
content.9: He holdeth back the face of his throne,
content.10: He hath compassed the waters with bounds, until the day and night come to an end.
content.11: The pillars of heaven tremble and are astonished at his reproof.
content.12: He divideth the sea with his power, and by his understanding he smiteth through the proud.
content.13: By his spirit he hath garnished the heavens; his hand hath formed the crooked serpent.
